title: Chinese tiles manufactures call on SAPM, discuss FBR’s camera installation policy
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 21 (APP):A delegation from the Chinese tiles industry on Tuesday met with Special Assistant to the Prime Minister on Industries and Production Haroon Akhtar Khan and discussed the camera installation policy in the tiles and ceramics sector by the Federal Board of Revenue’s (FBR).

During the meeting, Haroon Akhtar clarified that the cameras are being installed only on the production line for counting tiles, and at the final stage of production for QR code packaging and product counting purposes, said a news release.

He said that Prime Minister has directed that Chinese investors be fully encouraged and facilitated in their business operations in Pakistan.

Haroon emphasized that all industries have agreed to comply with the policy and to install the necessary facilities accordingly.

“This initiative is of great importance and in the best interest of the industry,” said Haroon Akhtar Khan.

Haroon further instructed that no cameras should be installed at any stage other than the final production line, and any violation in this regard should be reported to the government.

Khan reaffirmed the government’s commitment to facilitating investors and ensuring a conducive business environment, adding that such measures are aimed at protecting and promoting industrial growth.

The FBR representatives assured the Chinese manufacturers of complete cooperation and transparency regarding the camera installation process.
